The lowest number you can have with seven bits is

The first character in this character set is called 'NULL', the denary number code for it is

questiontext.text: The diagram shown above is sometimes used to represent a model of a basic computer system. Identify the correct names given to the each of the blocks.Â

subquestion.text: The box on the left is called:
The box in the centre is called:

questiontext.text: Select the words that are missing to complete the following sentences.

subquestion.text: Computers are made up of complicated hardware that store and process _____
If you break a computer down into its most basic components you have millions of ________ that either allow electricity to flow, or not
Imagine a whole row of light switches that you can switch on and off in different ___________ to mean different things. Each switch is either on or off.
Each switch only has two ______
That is why everything stored in a computer can be stored as a ______ of 1s and 0s.
This are called binary _______

questiontext.text: Match the titles and descriptions:

subquestion.text: This is the hardware part of a computer that executes programs and manages the rest of the hardware.
It is made up of the main memory, the processor and ...
The program instructions and data move between the main memory and the processor using internal connections called ...

questiontext.text: Complete the missing blanks from the following sentences.

subquestion.text: When a program runs on a computer it has to be loaded into the _______ first. From here it can be accessed by the processor to run each instruction in turn.
When the program is loaded the ________ is given the start address of where the program is in memory.
To run the program the processor will fetch an instruction, _____ it and then execute it.
This is called the fetch-______ cycle.
The speed at which a processor operates is quoted as the ____ speed

questiontext.text:
Sometimes computer systems are so important to a company that they cannot function without them.

Match the descriptions below with the term that suits the most.

subquestion.text: A way of measuring a systemâs reliability is to measure the length of time between system failures. This factor is quoted by equipment manufacturers as an indication of reliability.

If a computer systemâs reliability is very important then a company may need to have spare hardware in place just in case of system failures. One way to protect systems is to have more than one of a critical component.
If software or hardware problems occur, the data is most at risk. This will be stored on a disk on a server somewhere.

A computer system failure could mean that a company goes out of business in just a few days. Arrangements are sometimes put in place so a company can switch over to a complete, new system with all their own data on it, often with hours.

questiontext.text: Match up the following denary values with their equivalent value in binary

subquestion.text: The value "0" in denary is represented in binary as
The value "1" in denary is represented in binary as
The value "2" in denary is represented in binary as
The value "3" in denary is represented in binary as
The value "5" in denary is represented in binary as
The value "8" in denary is represented in binary as
The value "9" in denary is represented in binary as
The value "10" in denary is represented in binary as

questiontext.text: Match up the character set with the correct definition.

subquestion.text: A 7 bit character set with the full British alphabet and punctuation symbols is called
A 16 bit character set with 65,536 characters including international alphabets is called
An 8 bit character set with 255 characters is called

questiontext.text: Match the titles to the correct definitions:

subquestion.text: The set of symbols that can be represented by a computer.
A 7-bit character set used by PCs.
An 8-bit character set used by older mainframe computers
A 16-bit character set that allows many more characters to be coded including international alphabets.
An image that has is stored an processed as a series of values per pixel.
An image file that is made up of lines and shapes that have certain properties.
Short for picture element. It is the smallest component of a bit-mapped image.
The number of bits used to represent the colour of a single pixel in a bitmapped image.
The number of pixels in an image
The data that a computer needs to correctly interpret the image data in a file.

questiontext.text: Match the titles and definitions:

subquestion.text: A continuously changing wave such as natural sound.
Data that is made up of separate values. How data is stored on a computer.
The number of times per second that the sound wave is measured. The higher the rate the more accurately the sound wave is represented.
The time gap between measurements of the sound wave being taken.
The number of bits used to store the value of each sample. The higher the number of bits the more accurately the value is stored.
Takes real-world data and converts it to a binary representation that can be stored on a computer.
Raw facts and figures with no context or format to give them meaning.
Processed data that has some context and format so that it conveys meaning.
The group of commands available for a specific processor to use.
The group of bits that numerically represent a set of instructions
A piece of systems software that converts a program written in a high level programming language into machine code
A binary representation of a program.
A programming language written using a language that humans can understand. Examples include Delphi, Visual Basic, Java, Python and C++.
A programming language written using a language that computers can easily interpret. Examples include Assembly and Machine Code

questiontext.text: Match the words and definitions together:

subquestion.text: A single binary digit: 1 or 0
8 bits
4 bits
1024 bytes
1024 kilobytes
1024 megabytes
1024 gigabytes
Base 2 number system, used by computers, uses the digits 1 & 0 only
Base 10 number system, how we normally count, uses digits 0 to 9
Base 16 number system used by humans to represent groups of four bits at a time. Uses digits 0 to F
When the result of a binary calculation is too large to be stored in the space reserved for that type of data

questiontext.text: Match the appropriate labels to descriptions

subquestion.text: A combination of hardware and software components that allow input, processing and output of data.
The physical components that make up a computer system.
The programs that run on a computer system.
Hardware devices that take real-world analogue data and convert it into a digital form that can be stored on a computer. For example: keyboard, mouse, microphone, webcam, scanner, sensors.
Hardware devices that use digital data from a computer to produce a form that is understandable to a person. For example: monitors, printers, speakers, projectors, actuators (motors).
How much you can depend on the computer system being available when you need it. Usually measured in terms of availability.
The proportion of time that a system is operational, usually expressed as a percentage over a certain period of time. For example, 95% measured over 1 year.
A measure of availability often quoted by hardware manufacturers. For example 2.56 years between failures means that, on average, the hardware can be expected to last 2.56 years before it goes wrong.
Spare hardware components are built into a system so, in the event of a component failing, the system can swap over to the spare one.
Where a company has plans to replace a system quickly if there is a catastrophe (fire, flood, bomb etc). Designed to minimise the time the system is down.

questiontext.text: A computer system is made up ofÂ many physical and digital parts

subquestion.text: AnyÂ physical component that makes up the computer is called...
AnyÂ program that runs on the computer is referred to as...

questiontext.text: Match up the following hardware devices with the correct labels.

subquestion.text: Monitor
CPU
Mouse
DVD-Drive
Speakers

questiontext.text: Match up the following descriptions with the correct labels.

subquestion.text: Any physical component that makes up the computer
Any program that runs on the computer

questiontext.text: Match the endings with the correct sentences.

subquestion.text: Images can be stored in different ways on a computer. When you create a drawing in PowerPoint this is called
These drawings are made up of lines with specific properties such as line style, line colour, where it starts and where it ends. The computer will store all of this data about each line using
When you take a photograph on a digital camera it is processed as
Before this type of image can be stored on a computer the image has to beÂ  broken down into very small elements, each of these is called
As an example, the whole image may be 600 elements wide by 400 elements deep. The measurement 600 x 400 are referred to as
If the measurements of a picture is increased, then more elements will need to be stored. This increases the size of
Important information about the bit depth and resolution is stored inside an image file, this is called

questiontext.text:
Choose the words that match the sentences.

Computers are becoming more dominant in our lives for example, transport management systems, hospitals and banking.

As we become more and more dependant on computer systems in our everyday lives:

subquestion.text: It is really important that computer systems become even
As hardware and software improves, more people are able to make use of them because computer systems are becoming

questiontext.text: Match the answers to the descriptions

subquestion.text: What devices do all computer systems use to take data from the outside world.
What is used to convert data from the outside world to be processed on a computer
In what form is real world data stored on a computer?

questiontext.text:
In addition to professional standards, there are organisations and laws that exist to protect people and define standards for how computers systems should be used.

For example...

subquestion.text: When developing a computer system the use of the system on a day-to-day basis must be considered and how it affects the user. Developers design systems to meet the
When developers write software they create something from their own mind. This is referred to as âintellectual propertyâ, this is protected in law by the
An industry body that attempts to enforce the laws and protect developersâ rights is called the

category.text: $course$/GCSE Computing categories/Considerations When Creating Computer Systems

questiontext.text:
When developing and using computer system certain legal requirements apply.

Match the most appropriate law to each of the situations below.

subquestion.text: A dental practice accidentally publishes all of it's patients' contact details online
Many users of a virtual reality headset start to complain of headaches and dizzy spells

answer.text: The Health and Safety at Work Act

subquestion.text: A teenager is interviewed by the police after running a website for people to download Xbox games for free

answer.text: The Copyright, Designs and Patents Act

subquestion.text: Employees at a call centre experience higher than normal levels of back and muscular pain

answer.text: The Health and Safety at Work Act

subquestion.text: Sony are sued after hackers access customers' credit card details

answer.text: The Anti-social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Act

questiontext.text:
When developing and using computer system certain legal requirements apply.

Match up the descriptions to the laws below.

subquestion.text: A dental practice accidentally publishes all of it's patients' contact details online
Many users of a virtual reality headset start to complain of headaches and dizzy spells

answer.text: The Health and Safety at Work Act

subquestion.text: A teenager is interviewed by the police after running a website for people to download Xbox games for free

answer.text: The Copyright, Designs and Patents Act

subquestion.text: Employees at a call centre experience higher than normal levels of back and muscular pain

answer.text: The Health and Safety at Work Act

subquestion.text: Sony are sued after hackers access customers' credit card details

answer.text: The Anti-social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Act

questiontext.text:
When a computer system is designed and implemented it must meet legal requirements.

Match up the descriptions to the laws below.

subquestion.text: Anyone who stores personal details must keep them secure.
When a computer system is designed and implemented licensing must be considered in terms of which software should be used.

answer.text: The Copyright, Designs and Patents Act

subquestion.text: It is illegal to use software without having the appropriate licenses.

answer.text: The Copyright, Designs and Patents Act

subquestion.text: Employers are responsible for the conditions that their staff work in.

answer.text: The Health and Safety at Work Act

subquestion.text: Sony are sued after hackers access customers' credit card details

Designer of computer systems should consider how easy systems will be to use and any risks or hazards that there might be based on their choices of software, screen layout, input methods and the hardware used.

answer.text: The Health and Safety at Work Act

subquestion.text: Companies with computer systems that store any personal data must have processes and security mechanisms designed into the system.

questiontext.text: Match the input devices to the correct descriptions

subquestion.text: Often used as a game controller, but can also be used to control wheelchairs and to remotely control lights, security cameras and bomb disposal robots.
The software scans text/handwriting, interprets them, then generates a text file
Reads product packaging, generates the product number so the rest of the details can be located in a database.
Used on many compact portable devices where having a physical keyboard or mouse would be impractical due to size.
A device to allow the user to give positional data to a computer using hand and wrist movement while keeping the user's arm steady
A device to allow the user to give positional data to a computer using hand and wrist movement. Movement is detected using a reflected light source underneath the device.
A mechanical device used for physical data entry into computers by the user. Some users can accomplish data entry speeds of 80-90 words per minute.

questiontext.text:
Match each of the descriptions to the type of storage media used.

You can use some answers more than once.

subquestion.text: This is the oldest of the technologies and is used in floppy disks, hard disks and tapes
Moving parts make these media quite slow to read from or write to and moving parts go wrong more often than with other types
Lasers write data to a disc and read data from it.
It's possible to puchase about 50 of these disks for under Â£10.00
These use a newer technology called Flash memory that does not have any moving parts.
This media is very portable and uses lower power, so it is used in many portable devices like tablets and smart phones
Until recently, this was the medium of choice for distributing software.
Due to the lower cost of this medium, it is commonly used in desktop computers where portability is not as important.

questiontext.text:
Some developers actively collaborate with other programmers and create Open Source Software.

Decude if you think the following are True or False in relation to Open Source Software.

subquestion.text: Developers of Proprietary Software share the source code for their software to allow other software developers to improve it.
Developers of Open Source Software share the source code for their software to allow other software developers to improve it.
Open Source Software has a license, but there is no charge to use it. Anyone can use it.
Developers can sell Open Source Software if they choose to.
If you choose to develop new software using Open Source Software you must keep it open so that others can read and edit your source code.
If you distribute Open Source Software you do not have to share the source code as well.
Freeware is not the same as Open Source Software as you don't have to share the source code.
Open Source software is always released at regular intervals, eg. every 6 months so that paying customers know they will always have the latest version.

questiontext.text: Match the answers to the descriptions

subquestion.text: What devices do all computer systems use to generate action in the outside world.
What is used to convert data from inside a computer to a form that can be used in the outside world?
What component would be used to keep data on a computer after the power has been switched off?

questiontext.text: Match the printer to the description:

subquestion.text: Can use continuous stationery or multi-part stationery. Paper is fed through the printer using the holes at the side. The holes are then torn off to give a printed page.
An early form of computer printer, very noisy because the print head has to strike the paper through an ink ribbon to print text on a page.
Modern printer capable of printing 10 - 100 pages per minute at a cost of about 1p per page for black & white.
The toner ink is supplied in the form of a loose dry powder that is sealed or fused onto the page during printing by heated rollers.
It works by spraying ink onto the page so if you have big shaded areas on a page the page will come out a bit damp and wrinkled! For normal text they produce good quality printing at a low cost.Â
The ink is never sealed on the page so if the printed page gets wet the ink will smudge. Quite slow so they are not suitable for a large office or classroom.
An impact printer that creates raised dots on the paper to represent each letter
Designed specifically to allow visually impaired people to read.
It is important that computer systems that we depend on the most, work without any problems at all. This is known as system
Some computer systems have problems that mean they do not always work in the way that they are intended to. The way we measure how often a computer system can be used is known as system

questiontext.text: Complete the blanks from the following sentences:

subquestion.text: RAM is ________ so when you turn off your computer it loses its contents. It isÂ  used for temporary storage of programs when they are running.
When you turn the computer back on it needs to get the basic startup routine from somewhere that is _________ .
The operating system is _________ but it needs to be loaded into RAM to run.
The computer has a piece of software called the bootstrap loader. This is a small program that is ____________ .
ROM is ___________, this means you cannot write over the contents once it has been created.
ROM is also __________ , meaning you can leave the computer switched off for months and it will still start up as soon as it has power again because the contents of the memory are not wiped.

answer.text: for loading up the boot of the computer

questiontext.text: Match the type of memory to the description:

subquestion.text: All programs and data are loaded to _____ when they are in use.
The contents of __________ are volatile, meaning that when the power is switched off the contents are wiped.

When a computer is first switched on and before the operating system is loaded, a number of checks and tests are performed then the computer configures any hardware that is connected correctly, eg. hard disk. All of these instructions are stored in _____ .
DVDs and CDs that are manufactured in quantity for sharing media such as films and music are referred to as _____ .
The removable memory card on a digital camera is ______ .
Upgrading the total storage capacity or speed of _____ in a computer can improve the overall speed of the user experience.
BIOS - Basic Input and Output System is stored in _____ on a computer.
Removable storage devices like USB memory keys are measured in size by the amount of ____ they have available on them, 1GB, 8GB, 32GB.

questiontext.text: Sound Quality is affected by:

subquestion.text: The number of bits used to store each sample. The more bits used the better the accuracy of the sound file. This is known as:
The time period between taking samples/measurements.The more frequently the sound is sampled, the better the quality of playback.

questiontext.text:
Match the words to the descriptions:

Choosing the right type of storage medium for a particular use is important. You need to consider the following features:

subquestion.text: Amount of space to store files, eg. 200GB, 2TB
How quickly the computer can access data on the storage device, 550MB/s
How easily it can be damaged, how many times it can be used
How long it will last before failure

questiontext.text: Complete the following sentences:

subquestion.text: Reading from and writing to a hard disk is ____ speed compared to the speed of the processor.
Computers use theÂ ____ speed cache between the processor and main memory to improve system performance.

Main memory is used to store the programs currently in use, this makes the programs run at aÂ Â ____Â  speed compared to closing one application and then loading each program individually from the hard disk when you want to swap between applications.
Ideally, every program in use should be residing in main memory while it runs. AÂ ____ amount of main memory should improve the performance of the computer.
If a computer system has aÂ ____ number of programs open and running at the same time the computer will appear to performing at a higher speed.
However, if a computer system has a ____ number of programs running at the same time it will need to use lots of main memory.

questiontext.text: Match up the endings to the sentences

subquestion.text: Computer programs are made up of lists of
If you write a program in Python, for example, you use commands like print and input. However, to store these, the computer will need to represent these in
When you compile and run your program the computer converts the high level programming language into

questiontext.text: Match the description to the name

subquestion.text: One binary digit, either zero or one is called aÂ
A value comprising of four binary digits, e.g. 0100 or 1111 is called a
A value comprising of eight binary digits is called a
A value comprising of 1024 bytes is called a
A value comprising of 1024 kilobytes is called a
A value comprising of 1024 megabytes is called a
A value comprising of 1024 gigabytes is called a

questiontext.text: Match up the description to the correct values

subquestion.text: Eight bits is the same as
4 megabytes is the same as
There are 1,000,000,000 bytes in
1024 bytes can also be called
2048 Kilobytes is the same as
2048 megabytes is the same as
4096 Megabits is the same as

questiontext.text: How would you express the binary numberÂ 0101 in denary?
How would you express the 8 bit numberÂ 01100001 in denary?
How would you express the denary number '254' in 8 bit binary?
Which of these HTML RGB hex codes is most likely to display the colour red?
What is the full range of numbers that can be represented byÂ 8 bit binary?

If we type the following into the interpreter


>>> spam = 15
>>> spam = spam + 5
>>> spam = spam + 5
>>> spam = spam + 5
>>> spam

What will be output ?
How would you express the denary number 9 in 8 bit binary?
In programming, a function is

answer.text: a recognised code instruction that the interpreter understands
a custome written piece of code that makes your code work faster

questiontext.text: In computing, a string is ...

answer.text: a sequence of text characters including numbers and punctuation
a sequence of alphanumeric characters only
a sequence of floating point numbers

questiontext.text:
Software applications and data are loaded into memory from a hard disk.

So why doesnât the processor get the instructions & data straight from the disk?

answer.text: The read/write speed of a hard disk is much slower than the read/write speed of memory.
Hard disk drives are not very reliable, especially magnetic drives which have lots of moving parts.
There might not be enough space on a hard disk to store everything.
The computer might be using a very slow internet connection.
A processor is not able to convert the data stored on a hard disk into machine code because it is stored in binary code.
To reduce the amount of times that a hard disk is used so that it will last for longer.

questiontext.text: A device that performs some sort of mechanical action as an output.

If you type 2 + 2 into the Python interactive shell and press return, which of the following will be output, eg.

>>> 2 + 2

Which of the following are seen as advantages in following and using professional standards?Â  [Select up to four answers]

Developers can...

answer.text: Work in teams to develop a system because they all have a common understanding of the design tools and diagrams.
Move between companies because the standards apply across the whole industry.
Pick up someone elseâs design and code the program to achieve it.
Maintain somebody elseâs program when the customerâs requirements change.
Work for only one company because the standards will be different in other workplaces
Demand a high salary because nobody else knows how to maintain the program that they developed
Work in safety knowing that they will not be breaking any laws becasue they are following the standards
Steal another developer's work and pass it off as their own

questiontext.text:
Which of the following best describes what a computer is capable of.

[tick all that apply]Â

answer.text: it can receive data
it can store data digitally
it can process data
it can output data

questiontext.text:
When describing theÂ basic computer system model, which of these areÂ not included?

[select up to three answers]

answer.text: input

questiontext.text:
Which of these are not considered as an input on a smartphone?

[select all that apply]Â

answer.text: microphone

questiontext.text: What would the answer be if you were to add the binary values 1111 and 0110?
What would the answer be if you were to add 1001 and 0110?
Which of the following could not be stored as a Boolean data type?

What datatype would you choose if you wanted to store some of the following examples of data using the least number of bits :

  • On or Off
  • True or False
  • Male or Female
  • X or Y

One way of improving the speed of a processor at minimal cost is to use a small amount of much faster memory where frequently used instructions or data can be stored for a short while.

What is this special sort of high-speed memory called?
Which three of the following characteristics are most important when choosing memory or a storage device for a computer?

answer.text: what is the maximum read & write access speed?
how much does it cost per MB?

questiontext.text:
A line in a program that looks like this:

# This program says hello and asks for my name.

is used to

answer.text: Inform others who might look at your code what it is that your code is trying to do
Make your program execute more quickly
It is to convert an integer to an interpreter
print the message Hello on the screen and then ask a name
reduce the number of syntax errors in the program

questiontext.text:
What are the symbols below called in Computing?

==

!=

>

<=

Your friend offers to sell you her laptop at what seems like a really good price.

She is able to tell you the specifications of the computer, but can't remember which is correct.

Which of the following looks more likely as the specification for a laptop?

answer.text: 2 cores, 2 GHz processor, 256MB cache, 4 GB RAM, 200 GB hard drive
2 cores, 256 GHz processor, 2 MB cache, 8 GB RAM, 200 GB hard drive
200 cores, 2 GHz processor, 256 MB cache, 4 GB RAM, 256 GB hard drive
2 cores, 2 GHz processor, 4 MB cache, 200 GB RAM, 256 GB hard drive
4 cores, 2 GHz processor, 256 GB cache, 256 MB RAM, 200 GB hard drive
2 cores, 2 MB processor, 256 GHz cache, 256 GB RAM, 200 GB hard drive
2 cores, 2 MB processor, 256 GHz cache, 4 GB RAM, 200 MB hard drive

questiontext.text:
If you type in

>>> 'Hello ' + 'World!'


The output is 'Hello World!' .

What is this process called?

Â
Which of the following is NOT a De Facto standard for programming?

answer.text: Indents to clearly show where sections of code are
Comments in code to explain the algorithm and define the purpose
Meaningful names for variables so anyone can read the code
Name variables using lower case, and CONSTANTS using upper case
Always type function names in lower case

questiontext.text: When lots of people start working in a certain way and more people think it looks like a good idea and start doing it that way as well, this is called...
In computing, a variable can be described as...

answer.text: a place to store values in that may change during program execution
for converting an integer to a binary value
an interpreter for strings and floating point integers
a value that is fixed on execution but never changes

questiontext.text:
If we type the followingÂ into the shell in an IDE
>>> fizz = 10
>>> eggs = 15
>>> spam = fizz + eggs
>>> spam

What will the output be on the next line?

answer.text: It will produce a syntax error because they are mixed data types

category.text: $course$/GCSE Computing categories/Considerations When Creating Computer Systems

questiontext.text: Select up to 5 environmental issues that should be considered when developing computer systems

answer.text: Citizens in countries like India are being exploited as a source of cheap labour
Companies should try to employ people who live locally
Design can disadvantage parts of some communities
Computer system design should promote accessibility for all
Users of a system should be asked to sign an end user license agreement
Design systems that encourage people to work from home and therefore drive less
Designing new improved computer system means more manufacturing and use of materials
Designing systems that replace the tasks humans do means more leisure time for humans
Designing a great computer system can enable the manufacturers and retailers to make a lot of profit
As new devices and systems are developed every year, consumers dispose of the old devices that they no longer want to keep or use
As computing devices become smaller and more efficient, they require less energy to do the same amount of work

questiontext.text: Select up to 5 ethical issues that should be considered when developing computer systems

answer.text: Citizens in countries like India are being exploited as a source of cheap labour
Companies should try to employ people who live locally
Design can disadvantage parts of some communities
Computer system design should promote accessibility for all
Users of a system should be asked to sign an end user license agreement
Design systems that encourage people to work more from home and therefore drive less
Designing new improved computer system means more manufacturing and use of materials
Designing systems that replace the tasks humans do means more leisure time for humans
Designing a great computer system can enable the manufacturers and retailers to make a lot of profit

questiontext.text: Select all the questions below that can be described as ethical considerations:

answer.text: Is it fair that some people cannot afford computers?
Are countries like India being exploited as a source of cheap labour for call centres and for developing software?
Does the system design disadvantage some part of the community?
Does the system design promote accessibility for all?
Which version of the Windows operating system will the user have?
Will there be more than one person developing the software?
If people order some hardware from an online retailer, what is the cheapest way to post it to them?
If you're developing a new game, how many frames per second should be used to make the animations look smooth and realistic?
If choosing music for a new game, has permission from the copyright holder been obtained?

questiontext.text: Computer systems are complex. If everyone involved in creating, using and maintaining a system did things their own way it would make it even more...
Only one of these contains a syntax error. Which one?

answer.text: print(It is good to meet you' + my_name)
print('It is good to meet you' )
print('It is good to meet you' + my_name)

questiontext.text: Select all of the following that are examples of computers.

Select the term that is missing from the following text:

If you need to move work from school to your home PC you might use a USB Memory Stick (sometimes called a pen drive). These use a newer technology called ___________ . It is solid-state memory, which just means that it does not have any moving parts. This makes the access speed very high (but not as fast as RAM) and there is less to go wrong.

It is a type of RAM but will not replace the type of RAM used in the main memory as its access speed is too slow. This type of memory is also used in mobile phones, tablet PCs and cameras.
Which of the following is the correct Computing term used to describe numbers with a decimal point?
When a committee of people sit down and agree how something should be done, this is called...

Some of the purposes of a CPU are listed below

Select only those that are incorrect or wrong.

answer.text: manages the movement of instructions and data to and from peripheral devices

questiontext.text: What denary number is expressed by the Hex value xFF ( or #FF or FF) ?
Which of the following sentences is the most accurate description of this?

answer.text: When both inputs are on, the output will be on.
If either output is binary 1, then the output will be binary 1
Both inputs are inverted, so if the inputs are 1, the output will be 0
This is the symbol for the NAND gate
This is the symbol for the OR gate

questiontext.text: What name is given to the object shown by this symbol?
Which of the following sentences is the most accurate description of this?

answer.text: When either input is on, the output will be on.
If either output is binary 0, then the output will be binary 1
Both inputs are inverted, so if the inputs are 1, the output will be 0
This is the symbol for the AND gate
This is the symbol for the NOR gate

questiontext.text: Which of these is not a string?
Which of the following are not classed as an input on a conventional PC? [select one]
Which of the following are not described as an input on a smart phone? [select all that apply]
Which of the following best describes what an integer is?

answer.text: a whole number with no fractional elements
any number with a decimal point
a number between 1 and 99 with a decimal point
a number between 1 and 99 with no floating point

questiontext.text: A program that understands the instructions that you write is called

On the 26th October 1992 there were a number of issues affecting the performance of the London Ambulance Service (LAS). There were long delays while patients waited for ambulances to show.

There were as many as 46 deaths that would have been avoided had the requested ambulance arrived on time. One heart attack patient waited six hours for an ambulance before her son took her to the hospital. Four hours after that, the LAS called to see if the ambulance was still needed. Another woman called the LAS every 30 minutes for almost three hours before an ambulance arrived. It was too late, as her husband had already died.

What do you think was the most likely cause of these problems?

answer.text: A new computer system had been installed, but it had not been tested properly
Vandals had slashed the tyres of many ambulances meaning that there were a reduced number of ambulances available
Ambulance crews were on strike over plans to use computers to control the dispatch of ambulances
The satellite navigation systems on the ambulances had downloaded maps of Victorian London overnight
There was a great fire in London and the ambulance service wasn't able to cope with the demand

questiontext.text: Select as many of the following that are characteristics or features of magnetic media:

answer.text: This a very new, low cost storage technology that companies like Apple and Samsung are starting to use for hard disk storage
Magnetic disks are read with a moving head inside the disk drive
Moving parts make these media much faster than solid state to read from
Moving parts can go wrong more often than solid state media
A magnetic disk or tape can be easily wiped using magnets
Magnetic storage is much lower cost, so has higher storage capacity for data

questiontext.text: If a computer system is to keep lots of programs running smoothly at the same time it needs lots of _______________ .
What are the symbols + - * / called in Computing?
What is the full range of numbers that can be represented byÂ 8 bit binary?

While Python includes many built-in functions, some functions exist in separate programs. These have to be imported.

eg.

>>>import random

What are these called?

A turtle programming application allows the user to control the turtle's movements around the floor using the following commands:

â¢ RIGHT: Turn 90Â° to the right

â¢ LEFT: Turn 90Â° to the left

â¢ MOVE: Move forward one square

â¢ REV: Move backwards one square

How many bits would be required to store this instruction set in binary?
Select as many of the following that are characteristics or features of optical media:

answer.text: This is a relatively low cost storage technology that is being replaced by cloud storage solutions.
Optical disks like CDs and DVDs are read using a moving magnetic head inside the disk drive
Even though the disks spin at many thousands of revolutions per minute, this media is much slower than solid state to read from.
Moving parts inside optical drives can go wrong more often than solid state media
Optical media is vulnerable to damage from being handled
An optical disk can be easily wiped using a powerful magnet
The low cost of optical media makes them ideal for producing multiple copies
Optical disks can only be read so many times before the data is damaged

questiontext.text: Which of the following could not be described as an output device? [select one]

Sometimes when adding two 8 bit binary integers together it is not possible to represent the sum as it is greater than the maximum value that can be shown.

If a number is too large to be represented in 8 bit binary we call this:

The image below shows a patient's health being monitored in a hospital.

Select up to three input devices that may be used in this scenario.

answer.text: TFT screen to display readings of patient's data
printer to create hard copies of patient record history
a portable tablet device that the medical staff can use as they visit wards

questiontext.text:
The image below shows a patient's health being monitored in a hospital.

Select up to three output devices that may be used in this scenario.

answer.text: TFT screen to display readings of patient's data
printer to create hard copies of patient record history
a portable tablet device that the medical staff can use as they visit wards

category.text: $course$/GCSE Computing categories/Considerations When Creating Computer Systems

questiontext.text:
When creating a computer system the designer needs to take practical considerations into account that will determine if the software is to be completed on time or not.

Select up to three of the most critical considerations a developer needs to consider when meeting a deadline.

answer.text: the timescales it has to be produced in
which colours will work best for the user interface

questiontext.text: We all want computers to store files over a long period of time. We keep photographs, projects, music, films, letters and spreadsheets on our computers. We also expect our programs to be there when we switch the computer on. This long term storage is sometimes called ___________ .

The world that we inhabit is an analogue world of continuously changing variables.

In order to process or store data using a computer we must somehow capture it and convert it into a ________ .
Which of the following would create a random value between 1 and 20?

In 2012 customers of the Royal Bank of Scotland had their wages, payments and other transactions disrupted. Some customers were unable to withdraw cash using ATMs or to see bank account details. Others faced fines for late payment of bills.

Completions of new home purchases were delayed and some people were stranded abroad. Another account holder was threatened with the discontinuation of their life support machine in a Mexican hospital, and one man was held in prison.

What do you think was the most likely cause of these problems?

answer.text: A new software update had not been installed properly
Thieves had broken into branches of the bank around the UK in co-ordinated attacks and stolen all the money in the safe
Employees at the bank had downloaded a version of Call of Duty: Black Ops II which had a virus
Hackers diverted all of the payments into a Russian bank account
A cleaner at the bank had accidentally unplugged the bank's main server

questiontext.text:
As our society becomes more dependant on computers, it is increasingly important for these systems to be highly reliable.

Select up to three examples from the list below that are most likely to demand the highest amount of reliability to avoid disasters.

answer.text: On demand video services such as iPlayer, YouTube, Netflix etc.
Online grocery shopping, eg. Tesco, Asda, Sainsburys

questiontext.text: Which of these is the hexadecimal colour code reference for black?
In the list below, one item is not a software development model. Select the one that is not.
Select four input devices that a disabled user with very little or no muscle control from the neck down might be able to use.

Alan wishes to store the valueÂ "Ernie" in a variable called Name.

What would be the best data-type for him to use?

The image below shows a self-scan checkout in an Asda store designed for larger shopping trips that it can scan up to 100 items per minute.

Select up to four input devices that may be used in this self-scan checkout

answer.text: digital weighing scales to weigh the bagging area
till receipt printer to produce a record of items paid for
bright LEDs that flash to indicate if assistance is needed
conveyor belt mechanism to move items along
speakers to play recorded announcements, eg. "unexpected item"

questiontext.text:
The image below shows a self-scan checkout in an Asda store designed for larger shopping trips that it can scan up to 100 items per minute.

Select up to four output devices that may be used in this self-scan checkout

answer.text: digital weighing scales to weigh the bagging area
till receipt printer to produce a record of items paid for
bright LEDs that flash to indicate if assistance is needed
conveyor belt mechanism to move items along automatically
speakers to play recorded announcements, eg. "unexpected item"

questiontext.text:
Only one of these answers below lists the units for measuring the size of data in the correct order.

Select the correct one.
Which line when executed, makes the program wait for the user to enter text. Then stores the text string that the user enters into a variable.
When a user presses a key on a computer keyboard, what happens next?

answer.text: The keyboard controller detects which key has been pressed and a number code to represent that character is transmitted in binary to the computer.
The keyboard controller CPU sends the character to the computer as an ASCII string
A NULL code is detected and transmitted to the keyboard controller CPU
The keyboard controller uses a hexidecimal register to transmit the character data to the input bus on the computer
The number code for the keyboard is converted from binary to denary and then the keyboard controller sends it to the computer
The keyboard controller checks to see if the user has selected a Unicode character, if not it waits for a different key to be pressed

questiontext.text:
Sometimes it is necessary to use an older version of a programming language, eg. using python 2.77 instead of python 3.3

Why might this be true?

answer.text: Some legacy modules only work with older versions of the programming language
The new version of the programming language might have bugs in it
The new version might be a target for malware
Some people don't like change and prefer to stick with the older system that they've always used
It can be more complicated to use the newest version of a programming language

questiontext.text: Sometimes there just isnât enough main memory for all the programs that need to run. Computers can be configured so part of the hard disk behaves like main memory. This is called _________ .

There is a software development model that defines definite steps that are completed one at a time to guide the process from beginning to end. Each step has specific outputs that lead into the next step. You can return to a previous stage if necessary but you then have to work back down through the following stages.

What is this model called?
Which of these best describes what an IDE is?

answer.text: a development environment in which to write programs
an essential software update for an operating system to guard against malware
an example of a linux-based operating system
an Internal Device Enabilisation which allows a CPU to use a hard-disk as virtual memory
an Integrated Disk Enhancement tool which manages all the free space on a hard disk drive

questiontext.text:
A computer is a device which can r_____e data.

Type in the missing word in full below

Type in the missing word in full below

A computer is a device which can p_____s data.

Type in the missing word in full below

A computer is a device which can o____t data.

Type in the missing word in full below
A Basic Computer System Model is said to comprise of 4 parts. This includes input, output, and storage. Which part is missing?

What name is given to a data-type which represents a whole number with no fractional parts?

[Give your answer as one word only, eg. banana]

What name is given to a data-type which represents a number commonly referred to as a decimal, eg. 0.001 ?

[Give your answer as one word only, eg. banana]
A nibble is smaller than a byte.
A bit is the same size as 8 bytes.
A megabyte is equivalent to 1024 bits.
A terabyte is equivalent to 1024 gigabytes.
2 megabytes is equivalent to 2048 gigabytes.
A megabit is equivalent to 1024 bits.

When data is taken from the outside world it needs to be converted into a digital format to be processed by a computer. The data is always stored on a computer in a series of 1s and 0s called Kilobytes.

If the colour depth of a bitmap image is increased to improve the image quality, it means that less bits are used to represent each pixel, so the overall size of the file will be reduced meaning smaller file sizes.

Changes in memory technologies are leading to innovative computer designs:

Capacity and density: You can now use a 64MB SD card in a digital camera where a couple of years ago a 4TB card needed to be used. Higher speed processors means computers can store even more bits without needing to increase the amount of storage available. You only have to look at mobile phones and tablets to see how the optical drives on them have become even smaller and lighter and yet can now store more music and video without needing to increase the amount of storage available on the device.Â
The CPU in a computer is made up of the main memory, the processor, the cache memory and all of the hardware that is connected, eg. keyboard, mouse, display etc.

Todayâs modern CPUs can include more than one processor, or core. In theory having four processors should mean that the computer can operate four times as fast but this isnât always the case.

Unless the computer is designed to use multiple cores it isnât necessarily four times faster. Generally, a PC with a multiple-core processor running lots of programs at the same time will operate more quickly than a PC with a single core processor.

The speed at which a processor operates is quoted as the number of cores, in Hertz. Hertz is the name for the number of cores in a processor. Everything the processor does happens in all of the cores at the same time making it even faster. This means that more instructions are fetched, decoded and executed at the same time. A processor with 100 MHz (Megahertz) would operate much faster than a processor with only 1 GHz (Gigahertz).
A computer with a 400 MHz processor will always operate twice as fast as one with a 200MHz processor.

If program instructions and data are both stored in binary, the computer would not be able to tell the difference between bits that represent programs and bits that represent data.

This is why data is stored in hexadecimal in memory and instructions are stored in binary.

Some professional standards are not formally agreed, instead they evolve over time. Some people work in a certain way, others copy it and then this way of working becomes a standard, just because that is how most people do it.

You do not always need to write the leading zeros in binary numbers for them to be valid but we tend to write groups of 8 bits because computers usually store data in bytes.

For example:

00000011 is binary for 3 but so is 11.

The operating system on a computer needs to know where the data and the programs are located in main memory. Every location in memory has its own unique memory address.

If programs and data are stored in separate locations and the operating system knows their separate locations, a computer should not be able to confuse the bits that represent programs with the bits that represent data.

Changes in memory technologies are leading to innovative computer designs:

Price: New types of magnetic storage devices are available now which are cheaper and easier to produce than the more traditional solid state memory devices. Lower cost magnetic storage devices have improved the capacity of gadgets like MP3 players, hand-held game consoles and smartphones.

Even though the cost of computer hardware and processors has reduced significantly, the cost of RAM has stayed the same for the last 7 years.

The Python Software Foundation (PSF) have formally agreed standards that developers must follow regarding the names chosen for variables.

They have formally agreed that variables must always be in lowercase, eg.

name = "Fred"

number = 1

Decide if the following is true or false:

RAM is the type of memory used in the computerâs main memory. Many people say âRAMâ when they mean main memory. 'RAM' is short for Rapid Accessible Memory.

Before a program can run it has to be loaded from the hard disk into RAM so the processor can access the instructions. Any data needed for that program to run is also loaded into RAM while the program is running. The main purpose of RAM is to act as a permanent storage for programs and data, not just for the duration of that program. RAM is non-volatile, meaning that when the power is switched off the contents of memory are saved.

Some computers are not able to store binary numbers as individual bits because there are just too many pieces of information for the computer to store.

The hexadecimal (or Base 16) number system was introduced to enable computers to store and remember numbers more easily. Since there are less numbers for the computers to store, it means that computers are less likely to make mistakes. Hexadecimal numbers can be processed faster by computers so this makes the computers faster and more reliable.

So, instead of a computer storing a number as 0 1 0 1 1 0 1 1 it would store it as 5 B instead.Â

Sometimes the resolution of a bitmap image is reduced to improve the image quality, however reducing the resolution means that more bits are required to represent each pixel, so the overall size of the image file will be increased meaning larger file sizes.
A smartphone can't really be described as being a computer, because it does not have a mouse and a keyboard. If it had a separate keyboard and mouse then it could be called a computer.

Changes in memory technologies are leading to innovative computer designs:

Speed: Although some new memory storage devices are still much slower than RAM they are significantly faster than the traditional hard disks. This means that bulky and sensitive hard disks can be replaced with smaller, lighter, faster and more reliable memory devices. Computers start up quicker as this is dependent on how long it takes to load the operating system into RAM. So now we have notebooks you can slip into a pocket, tablet PCs and smart-phones that behave like computers.
The touch screen on a tablet device can be described as being both an input and output device, since it displays data from the processor but also receives data from the user's touch on the screen.

Examples of non-formal standards (De Facto) in programming include the use of:

â¢ Indents to clearly show where sections of code are inside a construct such as a loop

â¢ Comments in code to outline the algorithm and define the purpose of each part of the program

â¢ Meaningful names for objects so anyone can read the code and understand it, for example âTotalâ instead of âXâ
